Bogura, Chandpur, Chuadanga, Dhaka (Ashulia), Jhenaidah, Kishoreganj, Madaripur, Munshiganj, Narayanganj, Natore, Pabna, Shariatpur, Sherpur Salary: Negotiable Experience: 1 to 2 years Published: 23 Feb 2026 Application Insights View Requirements Education Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) Master of Business Administration (MBA) Experience 1 to 2 years The applicants should have experience in the following business area(s): Cement, Cement Industry Freshers are also encouraged to apply. Additional Requirements Age At least 22 years Credit Risk Assessment Achieving Old/Block dues collections target Financial analysis & reporting Accounts receivable & collections management Negotiations skills Responsibilities & Context Monitor retailer credit limits and outstanding receivables. Ensure timely collection of payment from cement retailers and distributions. Follow up on overdue accounts through calls, visits and written communication. Maintain accurate records of collections, dues and aging reports. Coordinate with sales and finance team to solve payment issues. Assess retailer creditworthiness before extending or revising credit limits. Identify high-risk accounts and recommended corrective actions. Ensure compliance with company credit policies and payment terms Minimize bad debts and overdue exposure. Maintain professional relationship with retailer while enforcing payment discipline. Negotiate payment schedule or settlements when required. Handle payment disputes, deductions or short payments. Prepare daily/weekly/monthly recovery status reports. Track bounced cheque, delayed payment, and legal cases. Support legal or arbitration actions for chronic defaulters. Conduct retailer site visits for recovery and verification. Conduct with legal teams for notices, agreements and recovery actions exposure. Compensation & Other Benefits Provident fund,Gratuity,Mobile bill Salary Review: Yearly Festival Bonus: 2 Workplace Work at office Employment Status Full Time Gender Only males are allowed to apply. The universityтАЩs Wellness Program has been launched in May 2024 by the Founding Director of Wellness and is currently in the functional stage. The incoming Director is expected to continue this legacy, strengthen existing structures, fine-tune service delivery, and scale the program for long-term sustainability and impact. The role integrates clinical services, preventive mental health programming, peer support systems, and policy development to promote student wellbeing, academic success, and resilience тАФ particularly for students from diverse and crisis-affected backgrounds. The Director serves as the universityтАЩs lead authority on student mental health, trauma-informed practice, and psychosocial wellbeing. Able to carry out planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of the ongoing business intervention of the project. Having good interpersonal skills and are able to maintain coordinate with project team. Good facilitation and presentation skills. Able to work in team and lead team. Good reporting skills (written and verbal) in both Bengali and English. Having good understanding on business development, marketing and business record keeping for project beneficiaries including budgeting, planning and financial management. Able to work with vulnerable and marginal community. Able to ride Motor cycle and have valid driving license. Have good computer knowledge on тАУ Typing both Bengali and English, MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and using internet. At least 3-5 years working experience in relevant position with experience in livelihood, food security or business development under any development organizations. Responsibilities & Context This position is primarily responsible for organizing all the agriculture based and livelihood trainings for the project participants and also provide technical support to the trained participants for starting small business in context to the project site. Therefore, this position will also organize training on business development, marketing and business record keeping on the above issues for staff and project participants. This position will conduct market assessment and link with the local resources for the growth of the business initiatives. This position will provide close support to selective business groups in starting environment friendly business. Also, will assist in building network with the local government agriculture, livestock and fishery departments, also will extend necessary follow-up and reporting on the interventions. Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Experience Minimum 5 years of experience in: Gender mainstreaming and womenтАЩs empowerment programming Conducting gender analysis, assessments, or studies in development projects Livelihood, nutrition-sensitive, fisheries, or rural development programs Community mobilization and field-based programming Designing, analyzing, and reporting on gender-responsive interventions Core Skills & Competencies Strong understanding of gender equality, womenтАЩs empowerment, and social inclusion (GESI) concepts Practical experience in gender analysis, data collection, analysis, and reporting Ability to integrate gender considerations into livelihood, livestock, nutrition, and fisheries interventions Strong facilitation, training, and communication skills in Bangla and English Experience in developing gender-sensitive tools, guidelines, and action plans Ability to collect, analyze, and interpret sex- and age-disaggregated data Case study documentation and report-writing skills Strong interpersonal skills, teamwork, adaptability, and problem-solving ability in field settings Responsibilities & Context Report To: Project Coordinator / Team Leader Location: CoxтАЩs Bazar (Five Upazilas: CoxтАЩs Bazar Sadar, Ukhiya, Teknaf, Maheshkhali, and Kutubdia) Contract Type: 12тАУ14 months The Fisheries Livelihood Enhancement Project (FiLEP) is implemented by the Department of Fisheries (DoF) with technical and financial support from JICA, aiming to enhance the resilience and livelihood security of artisanal fishing communities in CoxтАЩs Bazar. The project aims to enhance the resilience, livelihood security, and well-being of artisanal fishing communities in CoxтАЩs Bazar through diversified and sustainable livelihood opportunities, nutrition improvement, womenтАЩs empowerment, and strengthened compliance with marine conservation measures. Under FiLEP, the Livelihood and Nutrition Component (FiLEP-LNC) is implemented by Nature Conservation Management (NACOM), NewVision Solution Limited (NVSL), and Mukti CoxтАЩs Bazar, targeting approximately 1,500 fisher households across selected upazilas. Within this framework, the Assistant Livelihood Officer (Agriculture) will support the planning, implementation, and monitoring of agriculture-based and diversified Alternative Income Generating Activities (AIGAs), with particular emphasis on homestead gardening, crop diversification, climate-smart and nutrition-sensitive agriculture, and womenтАЩs participation. Job Summary: The HR & Administration Officer will play a dual role in managing human resources and administrative tasks. This position requires a balance of interpersonal skills and a firm grasp of internal policies. The officer will be responsible for the smooth operation of day-to-day HR and administrative activities, ensuring compliance with company policies and legal regulations. HR Responsibilities Recruitment: Support the recruitment cycle by sourcing potential candidates, conducting background checks, and aiding in the shortlisting process. Assist with the preparation and issuance of employment contracts. Coordination of HR Activities: Organize and schedule various HR-related meetings, interviews, and special events. Facilitate onboarding and orientation programs for newly hired employees. HR Reporting and Project Support: Compile and prepare regular reports on HR activities. Provide support in various ad-hoc HR projects as needed. Timesheet and Payroll Management: Oversee the collection and verification of timesheets for accurate payroll processing. Record Keeping : Maintain meticulous records of staff, including contract durations, leave records, and training completions. Leave & Attendance Management: Oversee and administer employee leave and attendance records, ensuring accuracy, compliance with organizational policies, and timely reporting. Policy Implementation: Implement and enforce HR and administrative policies specifically for the CoxтАЩs Bazar office. Exit Procedures: Assist in the processes related to employment termination, including exit interviews and final settlements. Performance Management: Support line managers in planning, coordinating, and administering performance appraisals for all employees across the organization, ensuring consistency and compliance with organizational standards. Volunteer Recruitment: Lead and manage the volunteer recruitment process in alignment with organizational policies and regulations, ensuring the selection of qualified and motivated volunteers. job_description: Project Lead, ERP Upgradation & Implementation, Accounts & Finance : SQ Group Jobs ENG ржмрж╛ржВрж▓рж╛ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List SQ Group Project Lead, ERP Upgradation & Implementation, Accounts & Finance Application Deadline : 25 Mar 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Skills & Expertise Company Information Summary Vacancy: 1 Location: Dhaka (Gulshan) Salary: Negotiable Published: 23 Feb 2026 Applicants are encouraged to submit Video CV. Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements 5+ Years leadership experience in ERP/ SAP Management in RMG. Good knowledge of banking transactions, loan processing, and reconciliation. Strong command of MS Excel and financial documentation. Good knowledge of banking transactions, loan processing, and reconciliation. Strong command of MS Excel and financial documentation. Strong project and stakeholder management expertise Strong understanding of ERP systems for RMG (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics etc.). Responsibilities & Context Lead core ERP upgradation and implementation teams in alignment with organizational growth and diverse operational dynamics. Evaluate existing ERP gaps and define future-state business processes in close collaboration with functional stakeholders. Coordinate with supervisors and governance bodies to ensure approvals, compliance, and progress tracking. Conduct As-Is and To-Be process mapping for finance while working cross-functionally with operations, supply chain, planning, and marketing. Ensure ERP processes follow RMG best practices, eliminate manual workarounds, and promote a single-touch, system-driven operating model. Manage the full ERP project lifecycle using structured methodologies and detailed project Gantt charts. Ensure timely completion of blueprinting, process optimization, and User Acceptance Testing (UAT). Proactively identify project risks and implement effective mitigation plans. Oversee master data governance and ensure accurate data migration for items, styles, buyers, vendors, costing, and general ledger. Facilitate seamless integration between ERP and all internal and external systems. Lead change management initiatives to ensure strong user adoption across head office and factory locations. Design and deliver end-user training on financial operations, SOPs, and user manuals. Act as a change champion to minimize resistance and maintain business continuity. Manage Go-Live readiness, cut-over planning, and post-implementation stabilization. Monitor system performance, resolve post-Go-Live issues, and drive continuous improvement through ERP enhancement roadmaps. Skills & Expertise ERP Software Microsoft Excel Microsoft Office Employment Status Full Time Job Location Dhaka (Gulshan) Company Information SQ Group Follow More jobs from this company Address: Corporate Head Office, Concord I-K Tower, Level 4, Plot - 2, Block- CEN

Responsibilities & Context We are looking for dynamic and driven individuals to join us as intern in Design & Creative, Finance & Accounts, IT, HR, or Business Development & Research Department , Supply Chain management to gain practical experience and contribute to impactful projects. Intern- Design & Creative /Finance & Accounts/Marketing/HR/Business Development & Research/IT/SCM Finance & Accounts Department: Assist in preparing and analyzing financial reports. Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities. Perform bookkeeping, reconciliation, and account management tasks. Ensure compliance with financial regulations and participate in audits. Maintain organized and up-to-date financial documentation. IT Departments Assist with IT system maintenance, troubleshooting, and support. Collaborate on software and application development projects. Help manage databases, networks, and cybersecurity tasks. Contribute to IT documentation and system updates. Research and recommend innovative technology solutions. HR Departments Assist in maintaining employee records and updating HR databases. Support the recruitment process by scheduling interviews and screening resumes. Help with onboarding activities for new hires. Assist in preparing HR documents like job offers, confirmation letters, etc. Coordinate with employees regarding attendance, leave, and other queries. Support HR events, training sessions, and employee engagement initiatives. Business Development & Research Conduct market research and analyze industry trends. Identify potential business opportunities and partnerships. Assist in preparing presentations, proposals, and marketing materials. Support lead generation and client relationship management. Track project progress and prepare reports for leadership. Design Department Assist in creating visual content (e.g., social media posts, banners, brochures, packaging). Collaborate with senior designers and cross-functional teams on design projects. Conduct research on design trends, competitor visuals, and creative references. Support in revising and editing designs based on feedback. Organize and maintain design files, templates, and project assets. Learn and apply design tools like Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesi

Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age 35 to 45 years The applicants should have experience in the following area(s): Knit Garments, Quality Control/ Audit Basic Computer skill, Garments/Textiles ERP, Advanced Microsoft Excel. Experience in Knit Garments Manufacturing Processes, Yarn Dyeing, Knitting, Dyeing and Finishing, Cutting, Sewing, Finishing etc. Communication and leadership skill is mandatory. Should have knowledge of all aspect of quality control methods and practices including AQL levels and other prevailing international standards. Positive professional attitude, self-motivated and team player. Responsibilities & Context Full responsibility for quality function within the location through the entire manufacturing process including incoming, in process, cutting, sewing, finished goods including inspection and any lab testing. Validates quality processes by establishing: Product specifications and quality attributes. Measuring production & Documenting evidence. To ensure all the garments are produced in RIGHT QUALITY & DELIVERED on time. Determining operational and performance qualification. Maintains and improves product quality by: Completing product, company, system, compliance, and surveillance audits. Collaborating with other members of management to develop new product and engineering designs, and manufacturing and training methods. Conducts floor audits and manage first article and first output inspection and report. Develop and analyze statistical data and product specifications to determine present standards and establish proposed quality and reliability expectancy of finished product. Plans, promotes, and organizes training activities related to product quality and reliability. First output review against the sample. Follow up first output garment measurement report. If any discrepancies occur it needs to be informed to the management immediately Need to finalize the critical operation, quality points and explain to Quality Inspectors. If any style runs in more than one line approved duplicate trim card for each line. Inline inspection findings should be discussed with respective Production, GPQ & QA team to get the corrective actions. Co-ordinate with Management on any requirement that can`t be met. Report any deviation in QA system to Management. Any other assignment given by the management. Workplace Work at office Employment Status Full Time Gender Only males are allowed to apply. job_description: Manager тАУ WASH- Access to and Utilization of Lifesaving Services in Chittagong Hill Tracts : Friends in Village Development Bangladesh (FIVDB) Jobs ENG ржмрж╛ржВрж▓рж╛ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Friends in Village Development Bangladesh (FIVDB) Manager тАУ WASH- Access to and Utilization of Lifesaving Services in Chittagong Hill Tracts Application Deadline : 01 Mar 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Skills & Expertise Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 1 Age: At least 35 years Location: Rangamati Salary: Tk. 115000 - 125000 (Monthly) Published: 23 Feb 2026 Applicants are encouraged to submit Video CV. Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age At least 35 years MasterтАЩs degree in Public Health, Environment Eng., Civil Eng., Development Studies, or Social Sciences or another relevant field. Minimum 7тАУ10 years of progressive experience in development and/or humanitarian project management, preferably in the WASH sector. At least 5 years of senior leadership experience managing multi-sectoral programs in partnership with multiple stakeholders. Proven experience in designing, leading, and overseeing WASH interventions, including locally adapted technologies for safe water supply and climate-resilient sanitation. Demonstrated capacity to manage complex, large-scale projects in challenging contexts, including hard-to-reach and CHT/Hill Tracts areas. Strong experience in institutional partnership management, coordination with government departments, donor compliance, reporting, and financial oversight. Excellent management and leadership skills, with the ability to provide strategic direction, technical oversight, staff mentoring, team building, workplan development, and budget management. Experience in capacity building and delivering training to diverse audiences, including government counterparts, partners, and community stakeholders. Strong English communication skills (written and verbal), including proposal writing and donor reporting. Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and other relevant project management and reporting software. Key Competencies: Pro-active Analytical thinking Result oriented Managing impact Flexibility Development oriented Thoroughness Responsibilities & Context Job Context: The Project тАЬAccess to and Utilization of Lifesaving Services by Marginalized Communities in Chittagong Hill Tracts in BangladeshтАЭ seeks to restore and scale up essential nutrition, WASH and livelihood services in the three hill districts тАФ Bandarban, Rangamati and Khagrachari. The project focuses on enhancing community resilience, ensuring that marginalized ethnic and rural populations have equitable access to lifesaving interventions and strengthening local systems for sustainable service delivery. The project period is from February 2026 to September 2026 and Friends In Village Developm

Ensure proper filing, preservation, and traceability of all bond-related documents. Conduct regular stock reconciliation between physical stock and bond records.
